references.paper_title: On the opportunities and risks of foundation models
references.reason: This paper is foundational in establishing the context and implications of large foundation models, which are central to the development and capabilities of GUI agents.

references.paper_title: Exploring the limits of transfer learning with a unified text-to-text transformer
references.reason: This paper introduces the T5 model, a crucial component in many GUI agent architectures, showcasing its versatility in diverse language tasks and its influence on model design.

references.paper_title: World of bits: An open-domain platform for web-based agents
references.reason: This paper presents MiniWoB, a foundational benchmark for GUI agents, influencing the development and evaluation of various agent designs and capabilities.

references.paper_title: Pix2Struct: Screenshot parsing as pretraining for visual language understanding
references.reason: This work introduces a key pre-training method for visual GUI understanding, highlighting the importance of multimodal learning and its impact on visual-based GUI agents.

references.paper_title: A survey on large language model based autonomous agents
references.reason: This survey provides a comprehensive overview of the broader field of large language model-based autonomous agents, which is essential for contextualizing GUI agents and understanding their place within the wider landscape of AI.
